##With 505 confirmed and 11 removed from their posts, how can prisons prevent an outbreak?

I-CAIJING

CAIJING magazine official Wechat. "CAIJING" magazine, sponsored by the China Securities Market Research Center, was first published in 1998, adhering to the news concept of "independence, exclusiveness and originality" , and is known for authoritative, impartial and professional reporting, it is a must-read publication for policy-makers, researchers and managers in the field of politics and economics.

As of 2400 hours on February 20, five prisons in Hubei, Zhejiang and Shandong had reported outbreaks of new coronavirus infection, all of which were imported cases. Of the 505 confirmed cases, no deaths had been reported

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Photo: UNSPLASH

By Wang Lina, Yu Qin, Xin Ying, and Huang Shujing, CAIJING reporters

Editor | Lu Wei

As of 24:00 on February 20,230 cases had been confirmed in Wuhan Women's prison, 41 cases in Hanjin prison, 9 suspected cases, one suspected case in Hubei Juvenile Correctional Institution, 200 suspected cases in Rencheng District prison, 10 suspected cases Diagnosis of 34 cases in Zhejiang Shilifeng prison.

On the afternoon of February 21, at a press conference of the joint prevention and Control Mechanism of the State Council, the head of the Prison Administration Bureau of the Ministry of Justice, He Ping, disclosed the above prison epidemic data. All the cases were imported infections, He Ping said. "So far, there have been no deaths of criminals infected with the new pneumonia. "

There was widespread concern that 505 people had been diagnosed in five prisons. Wang Gongyi, former director of the Judicial Research Institute of the Ministry of Justice, told Caijing that the most feared thing in prison is an outbreak of infectious diseases. Because the prison crowd is dense, the place is relatively closed, under normal circumstances each cell holds at least 10 people, the main activities of the prisoners such as eating, living, sleeping, studying, going to the toilet are concentrated in the cell. As a result, even in the absence of a major outbreak, "prisons take infectious diseases and public health emergencies very seriously. "

He Ping said that since the outbreak of the epidemic, the prison system has earnestly implemented the decisions and plans of the CPC Central Committee and the State Council on Epidemic Prevention and control, and strictly implemented the requirements of the State Council's joint prevention and control mechanism, all suspected cases and their close contacts were isolated for observation, and all confirmed cases were sent to the hospital for diagnosis and treatment to ensure that they were all treated in a timely manner.

He Ping also said that the prevention and control of the epidemic in the thorough screening, reporting is not timely, isolation is not in place, resulting in imported epidemic serious accountability.

According to a Xinhua report on the afternoon of February 21, with the approval of the Central Committee, the Central Political and Legal Affairs Commission recently formed an investigation team, led by Central Political and Legal Affairs Commission, Deputy Secretary General of the Communist Party of China, officials from the Central Political and Legal Affairs Commission, the Supreme People's Procuratorate, the Ministry of Public Security and the Ministry of Justice attended the meeting and went to Rencheng prison in Shandong Province to conduct a comprehensive investigation into the situation of the epidemic of new coronavirus pneumonia.

So far, 11 people have been removed from their posts in the prison system, one person has been given a serious warning by the Party and one person has been placed under investigation.

An imported outbreak in a prison

At present, the outbreak of the prison system, are "imported cases" , as a relatively closed place, the case is how to enter the prison?

On February 21, the Hubei Provincial Prison Administration announced that there were 271 confirmed cases of new pneumonia in the Hubei provincial prison system, including 230 cases in Wuhan Women's prison and 41 cases in Shayang Hanjin prison.

On February 21, the same day, Shandong Province announced an outbreak of new coronavirus in a Rencheng District prison. At the press conference, Xi Yan, Secretary and Director of the Leading Party Group of the Shandong Provincial Health and Health Commission, said that as of February 20, nucleic acid tests had been completed on 2,077 prison-related personnel in Rencheng District, with 207 confirmed cases, of which 7 were police officers, 200 inmates, and seven police officers had been counted in the Jining case immediately released.

Leo Wu, party Secretary and director of the Shandong Provincial Bureau of Prison Administration, described the development of the epidemic. On the afternoon of February 12, the first officer on duty in Rencheng District prison was admitted to the hospital for cough and was diagnosed as a new case of pneumonia at 22:00 pm on February 13, and at 18:00 pm on February 13, the case was diagnosed by nucleic acid test of a back-up officer in the prison. At 23:00 that evening, the Party Committee and provincial government of Shandong Province, upon receiving the report, immediately organized the relevant parties to conduct closed management of the relevant areas, and fully carried out the work of screening, screening, isolation, treatment and so on.

It was still Feb. 21, and according to the news released by Zhejiang Province, there were 28 newly confirmed cases of coronary pneumonia in Zhejiang Province yesterday, of which 27 were criminals from Shilifeng prison, plus the previously announced 7 confirmed cases, there were 34 confirmed cases of criminals in Shilifeng prison.

Earlier, on January 30, a document titled "Order No. 5 of the headquarters on instructing Shilifeng prison in Shilifeng province to immediately initiate the procedure of accountability in time of war" circulated on the Internet, claiming that the prison had been infected by civilian police, january 27 was initially confirmed as a suspected case of new pneumonia, January 28 morning nucleic acid test of blood samples sent to the provincial center for Disease Control Laboratory for review testing. On January 30, staff of the Law Enforcement Supervision Department of the Prison Administration Bureau of Zhejiang Province confirmed the document to Hongxing News.

At present, there is a confirmed case of prison in Zhejiang Province, Hubei Province, there are police lied about the life trajectory. According to official reports, a police officer from Zhejiang Shilifeng prison went to Wuhan from January 14 to 19, but deliberately concealed that he continued to work until late at night on January 25. He was diagnosed with new coronary pneumonia on January 29. A police officer at Hanjin prison in Shayang, Hubei Province, was given a serious inner-party warning for not reporting his life track truthfully.

The outbreaks in prisons in three provinces pose new challenges to the prevention and control of prison epidemics. The person who worked in the prison told CAIJING that his prison police staff had been closed in batches during the prevention and control period, with the first batch being closed for 14 days, followed by 14 days of isolation before returning home unharmed. The second group is quarantined for 14 days, then on duty for 14 days, and so on, the first group of officers on duty will be sent to prison. But because of the outbreak of disease in many prisons, his prison has been informed, the first duty of the police were scheduled to cancel the trip out of prison. "continue to be confined within the prison and the time of release is to be determined. "

What should prisons do to prevent an epidemic?

After the outbreak of new crown pneumonia, the prison is also the focus of epidemic prevention and control areas.

A former prison officer in Hubei Province told CAIJING that prisons have plans to deal with public health incidents. For example, during the SARS period, plans were drawn up for the prison to be completely closed, and the officers work in shifts, usually every half a month, in and out, taking body temperature, a pattern that persists to this day. He analyzed that the prison on the management of police negligence led to the outbreak of prison.

In a Feb. 21 briefing, Shandong and Zhejiang both said that previously confirmed cases of prison officers had been counted and immediately released in local cases. But the figures for prison inmates are the first to be released centrally.

According to Wang Gongyi, former director of the Judicial Research Institute of the Ministry of Justice, prisons are under the direct control of provincial-level units and are under the direct control of the prison administration bureaus of provinces, municipalities directly under the central government and autonomous regions, which in turn are under the control of the judicial departments of provinces, municipalities directly under the central government and autonomous regions.

Under normal circumstances, the occurrence of infectious diseases and public health emergencies in prisons will be reported to the provincial prison bureau, the Provincial Prison Bureau reported to the Department of Justice, for major public health incidents should be reported to the local Party Committee, the government as soon as possible after the incident.

The Ministry of Justice issued the opinions of the Ministry of Justice on the handling of major cases (events) in 2013 in response to major events, including major public health events (the opinions) .

The opinions require that laws and regulations such as the Emergency Response Law and the Emergency Response Plan for emergencies in the judicial and administrative system be conscientiously implemented, and that specific plans for the handling of major cases (events) be formulated and improved. We should strengthen the research and judgment, carry out the comprehensive evaluation in time and put forward the early warning of the important cases (events) discovered. For major cases (events) , the pre-disposal plan should be started to minimize the impact of major cases (events) .

In accordance with the regulations, judicial executive branch at all levels have designated personnel on duty 24 hours a day to ensure smooth communication in the handling of major cases. Important information in the process of handling major cases (events) shall be reported in time according to regulations.

Wang Gongyi told the reporter from CAIJING that all prisons have medical institutions, large prisons have hospitals, and prisons pay special attention to the prevention and control of infectious diseases in their daily supervision, "not in general. " For example, the common influenza and digestive tract infectious diseases such as dysentery, prisons have a more comprehensive response. "When there is a major public health emergency in society, there is also tension in places like prisons and schools where people gather. "

Wang Gongyi analysis, the large-scale epidemic occurred in several prisons, may be related to prison supervision, "one is not enough attention, the other is insufficient understanding of new pneumonia, leading to management can not keep up. "

An epidemiologist who has participated in the control of infectious diseases in prisons told the CAIJING reporter that prisons are a specific closed public place for certain groups of people. In the daily monitoring of infectious diseases, we should strictly guard against the importation of infectious sources, play the role of the warden, team leader, prison doctors, the detection of Sentinel infections or patients to report in a timely manner. "The advantage of prison management is that it is easy to focus on screening, it is easy to focus on people, it is easy to manage, it is easy to sample. "

An infectious disease infection control researchers to "CAIJING" reporter analysis, prisons such places, must be imported cases, the first is the source of control.

11 removed from their posts as accountability begins

He Ping, head of the Department of Prison Administration at the Ministry of Justice, said those responsible for the failure to prevent and control the epidemic should be held strictly accountable. The outside world is particularly concerned about the prison as a more special existence, in the epidemic in the prevention and control efforts?

According to public information, since January 25, the Hubei Prison System has fully implemented the first-level response to various requirements and measures, and activated the wartime mechanism to combat the epidemic into a state of war. In order to ensure the safety and stability of the prisons and safeguard the health and safety of the police staff and prisoners, during the epidemic, Hubei prisons entered into a state of emergency in an all-round way and started a closed duty mechanism. Meetings with relatives of prisoners were also temporarily suspended.

In order to prevent and control the epidemic, the Hubei Provincial Bureau of Prisons has also formulated the "contingency plan for the prevention and control of pneumonia in the event of an outbreak of COVID-19 infection in prisons, " A Leading Group for epidemic prevention and control has been set up, and eight emergency working groups have been set up, including those for maintaining stability, comprehensive coordination, medical treatment, material support, and information and publicity, and Emergency Coordination of 50,000 masks, 150 boxes of 84 disinfectant materials.

To January 31, the Shandong Provincial Prison Bureau held the second provincial prison system COVID-19 pneumonia epidemic prevention and control video scheduling meeting. At the meeting, the relevant officials "affirmed the effectiveness of the previous work, pointed out the problems and deficiencies in the work, analyzed the situation facing the epidemic prevention and control, and put forward requirements for the next prevention and control work. "

The Prison Administration Bureau of Zhejiang Province, on the other hand, immediately requested the provincial prison system to suspend meetings with prisoners from January 24, after it launched a first level response to a major public health emergency in Zhejiang Province on January 23. On the afternoon of January 26, the Prison Administration Bureau of Zhejiang Province announced that the prison system of the province had entered the wartime state of epidemic prevention and control.

According to He Ping, head of the Department of Prison Administration at the Ministry of Justice, the next step for the prison system is to "resolutely plug the loopholes, do our utmost to prevent and control the prison epidemic, and resolutely prevent the spread of the epidemic. "

Up to now, a large-scale epidemic has occurred in Rencheng District prisons in Shandong Province due to inadequate prevention and control. Xie Weijun, party secretary and Director of the Party Committee of the Shandong Provincial Department of Justice, and Party secretary and First Political Commissar of the Provincial Prison Administration Bureau, jiang Yunhua, Deputy Party secretary and political commissar of the Shandong Provincial Prison Administration Bureau; Wang Wenjie, Party Committee member and deputy director of the Shandong Provincial Prison Administration Bureau; Liu Baoshan, Party Secretary and prison director of the Rencheng District Prison Administration; Liu Yonggang, Deputy Party secretary and political commissar of the Rencheng District Prison Administration Bureau; Chen Weining, deputy director of the Rencheng District Prison Party Committee, Chen Weining, deputy director of the Rencheng District Prison Party Committee, Deng Tihe, deputy director of the Rencheng District Prison Party Committee, Deputy Director of the Rencheng District Prison (probation period) Fang Defeng, eight people have been removed from their posts.

The Department of Justice of Zhejiang Province has sent a supervisory team to the Shilifeng prison in the province to conduct on site inspections. The Prison Political Commissar Zeng Xianghua and the prison director Chen Rifei have been removed from their posts. The Public Security Bureau has opened an investigation into an officer involved in the case. Zhou Yukun, the director of Wuhan Women's prison in Hubei Province, has been fired after a large outbreak of the disease. A police officer at Hanjin prison in Shayang, Hubei Province, was given a serious inner-party warning for not reporting his life track truthfully.

So far, a total of 11 people have been dismissed from their posts in the prisons where the outbreak occurred, one person has been given a serious warning by the Party and one person has been placed under investigation. With the Central Political and Legal Affairs Commission forming an investigation team to conduct a comprehensive investigation into the situation of the new coronavirus epidemic in Rencheng prison in Shandong Province, more prison system personnel may be held accountable for inadequate prevention and control. (this article is an exclusive from tencent. Please do not reprint it!)
